metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5245 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the Ceph Object Gateway (aka radosgw or RGW) in Ceph before 0.94.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via a crafted bucket name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5245` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
ceph-common - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
ceph-fs-common - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
ceph-fuse - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
ceph-mds - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
ceph-resource-agents - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
ceph-test - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
libcephfs-java - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
libcephfs-jni - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
libcephfs1 - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
librados2 - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
librbd1 - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
python-ceph - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
radosgw - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
rbd-fuse - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
rest-bench - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.2').
